greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array A(row,col) = A255127(row+1,col) - A255127(row,col): the first differences of each column of Ludic array, read by descending antidiagonals as A(1,1), A(1,2), A(2,1), A(1,3), A(2,2), A(3,1), ...
comment: Not all rows are monotonic. See A276620 for their first differences.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10440; the first 144 antidiagonals of array
Index entries for sequences generated by sieves
example: The top left 16 x 15 corner of the array:
program: (define (A276610bi row col) (- (A255127bi (+ 1 row) col) (A255127bi row col))) ;; Code for A255127bi given in A255127.
xref: Column 1: A260723 (from the second 1 onward), Column 2: A276606.
Cf. also arrays A257257, A257513 and A276620 (gives the first differences of each row).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Sep 13 2016
